reviews.review_msg: took this class on my field school in greece.. he was extremely flexible and was always available (at the beach bar) if you had any questions.. his class was hard and a lot of work but then again it was 4 months of classwork crammed into less than 2 months.. awesome and hilarious guy!
Plays clear favourites. Lectures are incoherent. Avoid at all costs.
Unethical and pretentious. More interested in espousing her own beliefs than in facilitating open discussion.
Whoa..what a brutal course! Fairly hard marker-i would rate this course a zzzZZZZ...trust me-don't listen to the other reviews, cuz he wasn't easy at all!!
What a horrible prof! Make sure you bring a pillow!

Extremely vague with his expectations for assignments. Some of the tutorial readings were quite dry. He made us do a take home final which took most people about 7 hours to complete. It was an interesting class in the end but could have been better.

Extremely vague with his expectations for assignments. Possessed unrealistically high expectations and was a very difficult marker. Some of the tutorial readings were quite dry and chosen not for their content but for their length. It was an interesting class (liked the last 2 books, field trips, and  guest speakers), but was overall too difficult
Interesting Prof, but, tons of assignments! Lots of books, articles to read and films to watch. be prepared to devote most of your time to this class. Other than that it was very interesting.

Il Professore Garfinkel is probably the best and definately the nicest prof I have had at SFU. Loved the modern Italy class, interestign & innovative, inspired me to learn more about Italy, which I knew nothing about. but if you want a high mark you better be ready to work for it.
Can sum it up in one word: outstanding. And the films rocked.
Very interesting. A few too many notes but overal a good class. He was also very knowledgable

Definately into his subject, but if you don't see it his way, you're toast.  Expects everyone to come up with standard answers and agree with his opinions.  Entertaining lecturer, but if you don't know anything about Italy (as I did) you will have a tough time.  It seems as though he was way better in 106 and 224, but I wouldn't recommend for 390
Clear about expectations, gave an interesting lecture and gave very constructive criticism when marking assignments. Very helpful! Overall, she is just a really good person!

Despite being Irish myself, I found the course pretty dry. Lots of treaties, agricultural issues, and other standard topics. Perhaps my expectations for the material were too high. The prof is great though - organized, interested in the material, and knowledgeable - almost a teacher per se, in contrast to the 'lecturers' who do nothing to help you.
This is one of the few classes I've taken where I actually felt that I was growing as a person. I went in as an arrogant atheist and came out as a more accepting atheist.
Genuinely interested in his students. His interest and bias in his topic make the course fun and clear. Wants his students to succeed, very approachable.
No midterm and only one large paper.  Interesting class.  Openly disdainful of historians.  Can't quite figure out his religious slant but definitely there.  Post-modernist....ugh
very good teacher, easy course, easy marker, passionate teacher, very helpful
A bit strict on the rules in regards to assignment deadlines, but very easy going.  Accepts other student's opinions very readily.  Feels like a friend more than a prof.
if you go to class...and go to tutorials...you'll be fine...prof is cool

Excellent prof! Passionate about the subject and teaches it extremely well. Gives clear and concise instructions for assigments. One of the most approachable profs out there. He's a pretty hard marker though, grammer and structure count for a LOT of marks. & be prepared for a tonne of reading/week.
His class is fun and he is a really funny guy.

Teacher is probably the most helpful in the department.  Really cares about students and wants people to understand what he's teaching.  Keep in mind though, that he has very high expectations for your written work - I wouldn't bother trying his courses if you can't write really well.
